intro: Amsinckia intermedia var. californica, commonly known as the California fiddleneck, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It has hairy, lobed leaves and can reach heights of up to 1.5 meters. The California fiddleneck is known for its ecological importance as a food source for various pollinators and wildlife.
